get.summary: Get the status of the authentication
Get the authentication options for passkey

default.description: JWT access token after successful passkey authentication

get.summary: Get subscription page config by uuid

patch.summary: Update a user by UUID or username

200.description: User subscription request history fetched successfully

get.summary: Get user subscription request history, recent 24 records

post.summary: Revoke users subscription by User UUIDs
Bulk reset traffic users by UUIDs
Bulk update users internal squads by UUIDs

post.description: Bulk extend all users expiration date
Bulk extend all users expiration date

200.description: All users expiration date extended successfully

post.summary: Bulk Extend All Users Expiration Date

get.summary: Get Subscription Info by Short UUID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Subscription type (required if encodedTag is provided). Only SS is supported for now.

parameters.name: encodedTag
parameters.description: Base64 encoded tag for Outline config. This paramter is optional. It is required only when type=ss.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of subscriptions to return, no more than 500

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start index (offset) of the users to return, default is 0

get.summary: Get subscription by short uuid (protected route)

parameters.name: withDisabledHosts
parameters.description: Include disabled hosts in the subscription. Default is false.

get.summary: Get Raw Subscription by Short UUID
Get Subpage Config by Short UUID

post.description: This endpoint is forbidden to use via "API-key". It can only be used with an admin JWT-token.

get.description: This endpoint is forbidden to use via "API-key". It can only be used with admin JWT-token.

delete.description: This endpoint is forbidden to use via "API-key". It can be used only with an admin JWT-token.
delete.summary: Delete an API token by UUID

409.description: Config profile name already exists or inbound tags are not unique. Inbound tags must be unique in global scope.
Config profile name already exists or inbound tags are not unique. Inbound tags must be unique in global scope.

patch.summary: Update Core Config in specific config profile

get.summary: Get all inbounds from all config profiles
Get computed config profile by uuid

200.description: Internal squad accessible nodes fetched successfully
Task added to internal job queue

post.summary: Add all users to internal squad

200.description: Task added to internal job queue
Task added to external job queue

post.summary: Add all users to external squad

200.description: Task added to external job queue

post.summary: Modify Inbounds & Profile for many nodes
Set inbound to hosts by UUIDs
Set port to hosts by UUIDs

200.description: Nodes users usage by range (legacy) fetched successfully

get.summary: Get Node User Usage by Range and Node UUID (Legacy)

parameters.name: topUsersLimit
parameters.description: Limit of top users to return

200.description: Stats node users usage fetched successfully

get.summary: Get Node Users Usage by Node UUID

200.description: User usage by range fetched successfully

parameters.name: topNodesLimit
parameters.description: Limit of top nodes to return

404.description: One of requested resources not found
One of requested resources not found
One of requested resources not found

200.description: Top users by HWID devices fetched successfully

get.summary: Get top users by HWID devices

404.description: One of requested resources not found

parameters.name: topNodesLimit
parameters.description: Limit of top nodes to return

201.description: Infra billing history record created successfully

200.description: Infra billing history records retrieved successfully
Infra billing history record deleted successfully
User subscription request history stats fetched successfully
Returns nodes metrics from Prometheus metrics endpoint

info.title: Remnawave API v2.4.4
info.description:
Remnawave is a powerful proxy managment tool, built on top of Xray-core, with a focus on simplicity and ease of use.

## Resources
* https://t.me/remnawave
* https://github.com/remnawave
* https://docs.rw

tags.name: API Tokens Controller
tags.description: Manage API tokens to use in your code. This controller can't be used with API token, only with Admin JWT token

tags.name: Users Controller
tags.description: Manage users, change their status, reset traffic, etc.

tags.name: [Public] Subscription Controller
tags.description: Public Subscription Controller. Methods of this controller are not protected with auth. Use it only for public requests.

tags.name: [Protected] Subscriptions Controller
tags.description: Methods of this controller are protected with auth, most of them is returning the same informations as public Subscription Controller.

tags.name: Keygen Controller
tags.description: Generation of SSL_CERT for Remnawave Node.

username.description: Unique username for the user. Required. Must be 3-36 characters long and contain only letters, numbers, underscores and dashes.

status.description: Optional. User account status. Defaults to ACTIVE.

shortUuid.description: Optional. Short UUID identifier for the user.

trojanPassword.description: Optional. Password for Trojan protocol. Must be 8-32 characters.

vlessUuid.description: Optional. UUID for VLESS protocol. Must be a valid UUID format.

ssPassword.description: Optional. Password for Shadowsocks protocol. Must be 8-32 characters.

trafficLimitBytes.description: Optional. Traffic limit in bytes. Set to 0 for unlimited traffic.

lastTrafficResetAt.description: Optional. Date of last traffic reset. Format: 2025-01-17T15:38:45.065Z

description.description: Optional. Additional notes or description for the user account.

tag.description: Optional. User tag for categorization. Max 16 characters, uppercase letters, numbers and underscores only.

telegramId.description: Optional. Telegram user ID for notifications. Must be an integer.

email.description: Optional. User email address. Must be a valid email format.

hwidDeviceLimit.description: Optional. Maximum number of hardware devices allowed. Must be a positive integer.

activeInternalSquads.description: Optional. Array of UUIDs representing enabled internal squads.

uuid.description: Optional. Pass UUID to create user with specific UUID, otherwise it will be generated automatically.
UUID of the user. UUID has higher priority than username, so if both are provided, username will be ignored.

shortUuid.description: Optional. If not provided, a new short UUID will be generated by Remnawave. Please note that it is strongly recommended to allow Remnawave to generate the short UUID.

tag.description: Optional. Host tag for categorization. Max 32 characters, uppercase letters, numbers, underscores and colons are allowed.

excludedInternalSquads.description: Optional. Internal squads from which the host will be excluded.

tag.description: Optional. Host tag for categorization. Max 32 characters, uppercase letters, numbers, underscores and colons are allowed.

excludedInternalSquads.description: Optional. Internal squads from which the host will be excluded.

version.description: {"title":"Response Rules Config Version","markdownDescription":"Version of the **response rules** config. Currently supported version is **1**."}

items.description:
{"defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Blank rule","markdownDescription":"Simple blank rule with no conditions or modifications.
```json
{
  "name": "Blank rule",
  "description": "Blank rule",
  "operator": "AND",
  "enabled": true,
  "conditions": [],
  "responseType": "BLOCK",
  "responseModifications": {
    "headers": []
  }
}
```","body":{"name":"Blank rule","description":"Blank rule","operator":"AND","enabled":true,"conditions":[],"responseType":"BLOCK","responseModifications":{"headers":[]}}},{"label":"Examples: Block Legacy Clients","markdownDescription":"Block requests from legacy clients
```json
{
  "name": "Block Legacy Clients",
  "description": "Block requests from legacy clients",
  "enabled": true,
  "operator": "OR",
  "conditions": [
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "Hiddify",
      "caseSensitive": true
    },
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "FoxRay",
      "caseSensitive": true
    }
  ],
  "responseType": "BLOCK"
}
```","body":{"name":"Block Legacy Clients","description":"Block requests from legacy clients","enabled":true,"operator":"OR","conditions":[{"headerName":"user-agent","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"Hiddify","caseSensitive":true},{"headerName":"user-agent","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"FoxRay","caseSensitive":true}],"responseType":"BLOCK"}}],"title":"Response Rule","markdownDescription":"Response rule configuration.

**Fields:**
- **name**: Name of the response rule.
- **description**: Description of the response rule. Optional.
- **enabled**: Control whether the response rule is enabled or disabled. 

 - `true` the rule will be applied. 

 - `false` the rule will be always ignored.
- **operator**: Operator to use for combining conditions in the rule.
- **conditions**: Array of conditions to check against the request headers. Conditions are applied with **operator**. If conditions are empty, the rule will be matched.
- **responseType**: Type of the response. Determines the type of **response** to be returned when the rule is matched.
- **responseModifications**: Response modifications to be applied when the rule is matched. Optional.

**Example:**
```json
{
  "name": "Block Legacy Clients",
  "description": "Block requests from legacy clients",
  "enabled": true,
  "operator": "OR",
  "conditions": [
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "Hiddify",
      "caseSensitive": true
    },
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "FoxRay",
      "caseSensitive": true
    }
  ],
  "responseType": "BLOCK"
}
```"}

operator.description: {"markdownDescription":"Operator to use for combining conditions in the rule."}

conditions.description: {"markdownDescription":"Array of conditions to check against the request headers. Conditions are applied with **operator**. If conditions are empty, the rule will be matched."}

items.description: {"markdownDescription":"Condition to check against the **headerName**.","defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Check if header contains \"text/html\"","markdownDescription":"Condition to check if **headerName** contains \"text/html\"","body":{"headerName":"accept","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"text/html","caseSensitive":true}}]}

headerName.description: {"markdownDescription":"**Name** of the HTTP header to check. Must comply with RFC 7230."}

operator.description: {"errorMessage":"Invalid operator. Please select a valid operator.","markdownDescription":"Operator to use for comparing the `headerName` with `value`.","markdownEnumDescriptions":["Performs an exact, comparison between the header value and specified string. `string === value`","Ensures the header value does not exactly match the specified string. `string !== value`","Checks if the header value contains the specified string as a substring. `string.includes()`","Verifies the header value does not contain the specified string as a substring. `!string.includes()`","Validates that the header value begins with the specified string. `string.startsWith()`","Validates that the header value does not begin with the specified string. `!string.startsWith()`","Confirms the header value ends with the specified string. `string.endsWith()`","Confirms the header value does not end with the specified string. `!string.endsWith()`","Evaluates if the header value matches the specified regular expression pattern. `regex.test()`","Evaluates if the header value does not match the specified regular expression pattern. `!regex.test()`"]}

responseType.description: {"errorMessage":"Invalid response type. Please select a valid response type.","markdownDescription":"Type of the response. Determines the type of **response** to be returned when the rule is matched.","markdownEnumDescriptions":["Return **subscription** in XRAY-JSON format. (Using `Xray Json` template)","Return **subscription** in BASE64 encoded string. Compatible with most client application with Xray core.","Return **subscription** in Mihomo format. (Using `Mihomo` template)","Return **subscription** in Stash format. (Using `Stash` template)","Return **subscription** in Clash format. (Using `Clash` template) Useful for client application that use Legacy Clash core.","Return **subscription** in Singbox format. (Using `Singbox` template) Format which is used by Singbox client application.","Return **subscription** as browser format. The same as on `/info` route.","**Drop** request and return `403` status code.","**Drop** request and return `404` status code.","**Drop** request and return `451` status code.","**Drop** the socket connection."]}

responseModifications.description: {"examples":[{"headers":[{"key":"X-Custom-Header","value":"CustomValue"}]}],"markdownDescription":"Response modifications to be applied when the rule is matched. Optional."}

headers.description: {"defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Add custom header","markdownDescription":"Add a custom header to the response","body":[{"key":"X-Custom-Header","value":"CustomValue"}]}],"markdownDescription":"Array of headers to be added when the rule is matched."}

items.description: {"markdownDescription":"**Key** and **value** of the response header will be added to the response."}

key.description: {"markdownDescription":"Key of the response header. Must comply with RFC 7230."}

subscriptionTemplate.description: {"markdownDescription":"Override the subscription template with the given name. If not provided, the default subscription template will be used. If the template name is not found, the default subscription template for this type will be used. **This modification have higher priority than settings from External Squads.**"}

Please select a valid operator.","markdownDescription":"Operator to use for comparing the `headerName` with `value`.","markdownEnumDescriptions":["Performs an exact, comparison between the header value and specified string. `string === value`","Ensures the header value does not exactly match the specified string. `string !== value`","Checks if the header value contains the specified string as a substring. `string.includes()`","Verifies the header value does not contain the specified string as a substring. `!string.includes()`","Validates that the header value begins with the specified string. `string.startsWith()`","Validates that the header value does not begin with the specified string. `!string.startsWith()`","Confirms the header value ends with the specified string. `string.endsWith()`","Confirms the header value does not end with the specified string. `!string.endsWith()`","Evaluates if the header value matches the specified regular expression pattern. `regex.test()`","Evaluates if the header value does not match the specified regular expression pattern. `!regex.test()`"]}

responseType.description: {"errorMessage":"Invalid response type. Please select a valid response type.","markdownDescription":"Type of the response. Determines the type of **response** to be returned when the rule is matched.","markdownEnumDescriptions":["Return **subscription** in XRAY-JSON format. (Using `Xray Json` template)","Return **subscription** in BASE64 encoded string. Compatible with most client application with Xray core.","Return **subscription** in Mihomo format. (Using `Mihomo` template)","Return **subscription** in Stash format. (Using `Stash` template)","Return **subscription** in Clash format. (Using `Clash` template) Useful for client application that use Legacy Clash core.","Return **subscription** in Singbox format. (Using `Singbox` template) Format which is used by Singbox client application.","Return **subscription** as browser format. The same as on `/info` route.","**Drop** request and return `403` status code.","**Drop** request and return `404` status code.","**Drop** request and return `451` status code.","**Drop** the socket connection."]}

responseModifications.description: {"examples":[{"headers":[{"key":"X-Custom-Header","value":"CustomValue"}]}],"markdownDescription":"Response modifications to be applied when the rule is matched. Optional."}

headers.description: {"defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Add custom header","markdownDescription":"Add a custom header to the response","body":[{"key":"X-Custom-Header","value":"CustomValue"}]}],"markdownDescription":"Array of headers to be added when the rule is matched."}

items.description: {"markdownDescription":"**Key** and **value** of the response header will be added to the response."}

key.description: {"markdownDescription":"Key of the response header. Must comply with RFC 7230."}

subscriptionTemplate.description: {"markdownDescription":"Override the subscription template with the given name. If not provided, the default subscription template will be used. If the template name is not found, the default subscription template for this type will be used. **This modification have higher priority than settings from External Squads.**"}

version.description: {"title":"Response Rules Config Version","markdownDescription":"Version of the **response rules** config. Currently supported version is **1**."}

items.description:
{"defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Blank rule","markdownDescription":"Simple blank rule with no conditions or modifications.
```json
{
  "name": "Blank rule",
  "description": "Blank rule",
  "operator": "AND",
  "enabled": true,
  "conditions": [],
  "responseType": "BLOCK",
  "responseModifications": {
    "headers": []
  }
}
```","body":{"name":"Blank rule","description":"Blank rule","operator":"AND","enabled":true,"conditions":[],"responseType":"BLOCK","responseModifications":{"headers":[]}}},{"label":"Examples: Block Legacy Clients","markdownDescription":"Block requests from legacy clients
```json
{
  "name": "Block Legacy Clients",
  "description": "Block requests from legacy clients",
  "enabled": true,
  "operator": "OR",
  "conditions": [
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "Hiddify",
      "caseSensitive": true
    },
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "FoxRay",
      "caseSensitive": true
    }
  ],
  "responseType": "BLOCK"
}
```","body":{"name":"Block Legacy Clients","description":"Block requests from legacy clients","enabled":true,"operator":"OR","conditions":[{"headerName":"user-agent","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"Hiddify","caseSensitive":true},{"headerName":"user-agent","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"FoxRay","caseSensitive":true}],"responseType":"BLOCK"}}],"title":"Response Rule","markdownDescription":"Response rule configuration.

**Fields:**
- **name**: Name of the response rule.
- **description**: Description of the response rule. Optional.
- **enabled**: Control whether the response rule is enabled or disabled. 

 - `true` the rule will be applied. 

 - `false` the rule will be always ignored.
- **operator**: Operator to use for combining conditions in the rule.
- **conditions**: Array of conditions to check against the request headers. Conditions are applied with **operator**. If conditions are empty, the rule will be matched.
- **responseType**: Type of the response. Determines the type of **response** to be returned when the rule is matched.
- **responseModifications**: Response modifications to be applied when the rule is matched. Optional.

**Example:**
```json
{
  "name": "Block Legacy Clients",
  "description": "Block requests from legacy clients",
  "enabled": true,
  "operator": "OR",
  "conditions": [
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "Hiddify",
      "caseSensitive": true
    },
    {
      "headerName": "user-agent",
      "operator": "CONTAINS",
      "value": "FoxRay",
      "caseSensitive": true
    }
  ],
  "responseType": "BLOCK"
}
```"}

operator.description: {"markdownDescription":"Operator to use for combining conditions in the rule."}

conditions.description: {"markdownDescription":"Array of conditions to check against the request headers. Conditions are applied with **operator**. If conditions are empty, the rule will be matched."}

items.description: {"markdownDescription":"Condition to check against the **headerName**.","defaultSnippets":[{"label":"Examples: Check if header contains \"text/html\"","markdownDescription":"Condition to check if **headerName** contains \"text/html\"","body":{"headerName":"accept","operator":"CONTAINS","value":"text/html","caseSensitive":true}}]}
